page.title: 10FARMING - 4
page.content: {Quinmoor Farm, Broadwell,}is owner farmed by a family who bought up several small farms making 184 hectares. A Friesian dairy herd is kept on the wettest 24 hectares of permanent grassland. The grass is unsprayed but manure and artificial fertiliser is spread. 95 cows are milked daily. The Oxford bulk tanker collects milk at 9 am every morning for the Kidlington dairy. An emergency tank will hold milk on the farm in the event of snow-bound roads. 2 year old heifers and 9 month old calves are fed farm produced barley, oats and hay. 500 tons of silage are made annually. Cereals are dried on the farm. Machinery includes 5 tractors, a combine harvester, a bailer sprayer and a muck-spreader.
